text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to identify the relevant Moral Right to the alteration of character as the Right of Integrity (s.80 CDPA 1988). The candidate answer explicitly discusses the moral rights under Chapter IV of the CDPA 1988, stating: \"Section 80: The right to object to derogatory treatment of your work. 'Treatment' includes any addition, deletion, alteration, or adaptation... If the altered version of Ophelia distorts or mutilates your work... this right is engaged.\" This directly identifies and explains the Right of Integrity (s.80 CDPA 1988) in relation to the altered character.", "criterion_id": "07e967a4-3303-4bab-a56d-961b4b8ee3fd"}
